Problem:
Analyze a system governed by the linear partial differential equation \\(\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu\\), where L is a linear differential operator. Consider an integral transformation defined by \\( v(x, t) = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} K(x, y) u(y, t) dy \\), where K is a kernel function representing the transformation.

If \\( u(x, 0) \\) is set as a specific initial condition and then allowed to evolve under \\(\\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu\\) without further intervention, will \\( v(x, t) \\) at t = T be the same as if the transformation \\( v(x, t) \\) was applied continuously over time t?
Explanation: The kernel function \\( K(x, y) \\) as part of the transformation integral can modify the impact of the linear operator L on the function u, thus changing the eventual outcome of \\( v(x, t) \\) when compared to applying the transformation continuously. The transformed solution \\( v(x, t) \\) might involve properties or characteristics not present in the original evolution under L.
